instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used on the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy?
Output: The study used Near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy on the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were adopted on the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy?
Output: Principal component analysis (PCA) was adopted for spectral feature processing on the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification accuracy of the models on the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the classification accuracy of the models on the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy was accuracy. The models achieved 97.78% and 97.11% accuracy for the validation set.

instruction: What were the optimization techniques used to improve the performance of the extreme learning machine (ELM) model in the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy using NIR spectroscopy?
Output: The optimization techniques used to improve the performance of the extreme learning machine (ELM) model in the detection of walnut shell-kernel separation accuracy using NIR spectroscopy were the genetic algorithm (GA) and the optimization of the input layer weight (W) and the hidden layer threshold value (B) of the ELM.

instruction: Can the proposed method using Near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy be considered superior to traditional methods for detecting the accuracy of walnut shell-kernel separation?
Output: Yes. Based on the information provided in the related study, it can be inferred that the proposed method using Near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy is superior to traditional methods for detecting the accuracy of walnut shell-kernel separation. The classification accuracy of the support vector machine (SVM) and extreme learning machine (ELM) models using this method was reported to be 97.78% and 97.11% respectively. This suggests that the NIR spectroscopy-based method is highly accurate in distinguishing between walnut shell, kernel, and chimera materials, making it a reliable approach for detecting the accuracy of walnut shell-kernel separation.
